sentences.sContent: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.sCn: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.sContent: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.sCn: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.sContent: ...What did the woman advise the man to do...
...I want to advise you to pay the normal one-way economy class fare of $555...

synos.tran: 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

words.tran: 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）
（美）受教授指导选课的学生；受到建议的人

trans.tranOther: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something
